sense.name: put to use, exercise
sense.examples: So we must look elsewhere for an explanation of the unusual power this case has exerted over the minds of many. As a journalist, he exerted power and influence through his newspaper.

sense.name: to make a great mental or physical effort
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare carefully to sense 1. This sense only includes reflexive direct object pronouns.
sense.examples: He exerted himself for the test. She exerted herself too much and now she's injured.
